intro: Benstonea eumekes, commonly known as the golden flame orchid, is a striking tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow and orange flowers that resemble flames. The plant features long, strap-like leaves and produces fragrant blooms during the summer months. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
